timeline.bodyText: I would maybe drop 'the' in this sentence, so that it reads "Setting to enable or disable JavaScript UDF support", or to phrase it as "Setting to enable or disable the Javascript UDF language".
timeline.author: autophagy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -658,11 +658,10 @@ Javascript language
 ===================
 
 **lang.js.enabled**
-  | *Default:*  ``false``
+  | *Default:*  ``true``
   | *Runtime:*  ``no``
 
-  Setting to enable the Javascript language. As The Javascript language is an
-  experimental feature and is not securely sandboxed its disabled by default.
+  Setting to enable or disable the :ref:`JavaScript UDF support <udf_lang_js>`.

timeline.bodyText: Should we maybe highlight that this does not affect the CE edition? (as JS UDF are only working on non-CE at all)
timeline.author: seut
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -69,6 +69,8 @@ None
 Changes
 =======
 
+- The Javascript user defined function language is now enabled by default.

timeline.message:
Enable JS UDF by default

The access restrictions with GraalVM are better than they used to be
with Nashorn. Users can still disable it if they've concerns.

Enable JS UDF by default

The access restrictions with GraalVM are better than they used to be
with Nashorn. Users can still disable it if they've concerns.
